etymology.description: ideogrammic: 氏 + 日 (sun), or abbreviated 氐 + 日 (sun) — the sun lowering/going down.
etymology.interpretation: Combines 日 ‘sun’ with 氏/氐 suggesting something low or descending, picturing the sun sinking toward the horizon. From the scene of twilight come senses of darkening and, metaphorically, mental dimness or confusion.

examples.chinese: 天色将昏(天色將昏)，我们赶紧回家(我們趕緊回家)。
examples.pinyin: Tiānsè jiāng hūn, wǒmen gǎnjǐn huíjiā.
examples.english: It’s getting dark; let’s hurry home.

examples.chinese: 他脑子发昏(他腦子發昏)，做事糊里糊涂(做事糊裡糊塗)。
examples.pinyin: Tā nǎozi fā hūn, zuòshì húlihútú.
examples.english: He felt muddle‑headed and did things confusedly.

examples.chinese: 傍晚天空渐昏(傍晚天空漸昏)，路上灯光亮起(路上燈光亮起)。
examples.pinyin: Bàngwǎn tiānkōng jiàn hūn, lùshang dēngguāng liàngqǐ.
examples.english: At dusk the sky darkens, and the streetlights come on.
